start.text: The start sequence number of the emails to be retrieved to retrieve a specific set of emails. The default value is 1

limit.text: The number of emails to be retrieved from the start value mentioned. The default value is 10

status.text: To retrieve emails by read or unread status

flagid.text: To retrieve emails based on a specific flag

labelidTo.text: retrieve emails based on a specific label

sortBy.text: The list of emails can be sort by date messageid or size. The default sort order is date

sortorder.text:
The sort order of the retrieved list whether ascending or descending need to be specified here.
includeto

includearchive.text: Whether the Archived emails need to be included or not on the list of emails retrieved.

includesent.text: Whether Sent emails need to be included or not on the list of emails retrieved

fields.text: The list of fields that need to included in the retrieved list or not

attachedMails.text: To retrieve only the emails with attachments

inlinedMails.text:
To retrieve only the emails with inlines.

planType.text: Provide the plan value subscribed by the Organization as the plan type

limit.text: This parameter is used to get the Spam listing details of the organization in batches. You need to specify the number of items to be retrieved in each batch.The maximum allowed value is 500

start.text: You can use this parameter to fetch the Spam listing details of the organization in batches. You need to specify the order number from which the data retrieval should start.This parameter works better when used with the limit parameter

spamCategory.text: Use this parameter to specify the type of Spam Listing to be retrieved

mode.text: This is the parameter to denote the mode of action that is performed by the API

fromIpRange.text: The fromIpRange denotes the start of the IP address range that's allowed for your users to access their accounts.

toIpRange.text: The toIpRange denotes the end of the IP address range that's allowed for your users to access their accounts

roleId.text: The roleId helps you to assign the allowed IP range to different users in your organization

ipId.text: The ipId denotes the ID assigned to the IP ranges added to certain users in the organization and can be fetched using the GET Allowed IPs API

meta.description: Get all Tasks in a project with a given status

group_id.text: The unique identifier used for groups in the organization

Title.text: The title for the task that is being added

Status.text: The status of completion of the task

Priority.text: The priority to be given for the task

projectId.text: The unique identifer assigned to each project created for group tasks

dueDate.text: The due date that you want to set for the task

dueDateRemindersEnabled.text: Whether reminders on the date when the task is due is enabled or disabled

reminderDate.text: The date when you want to be reminded about the task

emailReminder.text: If reminders need to be sent via email

popupReminder.text: If reminder notifications need be sent

remindOwner.text: If the task owner needs to reminded

remindAssignee.text: If the member to whom the task is assigned needs to be reminded

Assignee.text: The zuid of the member to whom the task is assigned

subtask.text: The details of the subtask that has to be added as a task

accountId.text: Specifies the account identifier for a specific account of a particular user

messageId.text: Specifies the unique key used to identify a specific email

followers.text: The members who need to follow this task

lockInvites.text: If the permission to invite members has to be enabled or disabled

allowComments.text: If comments for the task can be allowed or not

Recurring type.text: The recurrence pattern for the task

recurringFrequency.text: The frequency at which the task has to recur

recurFrom.text: The date from which recurrence has to start

recurUntil.text: The date until which the task has to recur

recurFor.text: The number of times the task has to recur

recurDailyOnlyOnWeekdays.text: If the task has to recur everyday in the weekdays

recurWeeklyOn.text: The day of the week when the task has to recur every week

recurMonthlyOnDayOfWeekInMonth.text: The day of the week in a particular month when the task has to recur every month

recurMonthlyOnDayOfMonth.text: The day of the month when the task has to recur every month

recurMonthlyOnDayOfWeek.text: The day of the week when the task has to recur every month

recurYearlyOnDayOfWeekInMonth.text: The day of the week in a particular month when the task has to recur every year

recurYearlyOnDayOfMonth.text: The date of the month when the task has to recur every year

recurYearlyOnDayOfWeek.text: The day of the week when the task has to recur every year

recurYearlyOnMonth.text: The month when the task has to recur for that year

account_id.text: This is the unique identifier for a particular user account.

threadId.text: Single or Multiple Thread Ids that need(s) to be marked as not spam

mode.text: Provide the mode as markNotSpam to mark a thread as not spam

isArchive.text: If the email thread is archived or not

isFolderSpecific.text: If a thread that needs to be marked as not spam is folder specific folderId is mandatory.

folderId.text: FolderId of the folder in which a thread is to be marked as not spam

primaryEmailAddress.text: Specifies the domain-based primary email address for the user to be created.

password.text: Specifies the password for the user to be created.

displayName.text: Specifies the display name to be assigned to the user.

role.text: Specifies the role to be assigned for the user to be created.

country.text: Specifies the country the user works from. Refer here for allowed values.

language.text: Specifies the choice of language for the user. Refer here for allowed values.

timeZone.text: Specifies the timezone the user works from. Refer here for allowed values.

oneTimePassword.text: Specifies if the password is a one-time password.

groupMailList.text: Specifies an array of the group's email addresses to which the user needs to be added.

employeeId.text: Provide the employee ID of the user.

lastName.text: Provide the last name of the user.

department.text: Provide the department in which the user works.

designation.text: Provide the designation the user holds.

mobileNumber.text: Provide the mobile number of the user.

extension.text: Provide the extension number of the user.
